title: About
text: My name is Grayce Lalim. I’m a junior Sports Media and Communications and Advertising and Public Relations double major at the University of Nebraska-Lincoln. I’m originally from Sioux Falls, South Dakota. Currently, I’m exploring opportunities in communications, PR, and social media, with experience in student-led marketing teams and leadership roles on campus. I’m also interested in the intersection of business and sports, aiming to work in a role that connects people and enhances fan experiences.

title: From Stats to Success: Matt Rhule’s Impact on Nebraska Football
text:
In September 2022, Nebraska football fires head coach Scott Frost, who was hired under the pretense of “Saving” Nebraska football. Then, in November of 2022, Nebraska hired Matt Rhule as the new head coach. Rhule has a reputation of revilalizing programs like Temple and Baylor. Matt Rhule signed a

library(tidyverse)

✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1

✔ purrr     1.0.2

✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors




Code
scoring <- read_csv("data/scoring.csv")


Rows: 3 Columns: 23
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): Player
dbl (18): Season, G, RushTD, RecTD, PRTD, KRTD, FRTD, IntTD, OthTD, TD, XPM,...
lgl  (4): Rk, Pos, Pts/G, Awards

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.




Code
ggplot() +
  geom_bar(
    data = scoring,
    aes(
      x = reorder(Season, Pts),
      weight = Pts
    ), fill="red"
  ) +
  labs(
    title = "Total Points Scored by Season",
    x = "Season",
    y = "Total Points",
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    title = element_text(color = "black", size = 10, face = "bold"),
    axis.text = element_text(color = "black")
  )

library(tidyverse)

(1): Player dbl (17): Season, G, Solo, Ast, Comb, TFL, Sk, Int, Yds...12, Avg,
IntTD, PD... lgl (3): Rk, Pos, Awards

Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_line(data=defense, aes(x=Season, y=Int), color="red") +
  geom_point(data=defense, aes(x=Season, y=Int), color="red")











Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)
library(wehoop)




Code
offense <- read_csv("data/offense.csv")


Rows: 3 Columns: 23
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
chr  (1): Player
dbl (18): Season, G, Rush, Rec, PRTD, KRTD, FRTD, IntTD, OthTD, TD, XPM, XPA...
lgl  (4): Rk, Pos, Pts/G, Awards

ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data.
ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.




Code
totaloffense <- offense |> 
  select(Season, Rec, Rush, TD, Pts) |>
  mutate_at(vars(Season), as.numeric) |>
  group_by(Season) |>
  summarize(
    ReceivingYds = sum(Rec),
    RushingYds = sum(Rush),
    TouchDowns = sum(TD),
    Points = sum(Pts)
  )




Code
totaloffense |> gt()








Season
ReceivingYds
RushingYds
TouchDowns
Points

Code
totaloffense |> 
  gt()|> 
  cols_label(
    ReceivingYds = "Receiving Yards",
    RushingYds = "Rushing Yards",
    TouchDowns = "Touchdowns",
    Points = "Total Points"
  ) |>
  tab_header(
    title = "How Nebraska Offense Changed",
    subtitle = "Matt Rhule's Advancements of the Offense in Just Two Years."
  )|> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) |> tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "left"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  )|>
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("**By:** Grayce Lalim  |  **Source:** SportsRefrence: 2022, 2023, 2024 Nebraska Cornhuskers Football Stats")
  )|>
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=12)
     )
  ) |>
  opt_row_striping() |> 
  opt_table_lines("none")|>
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "red"),
      cell_text(color = "white")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Season == "2024")
  )
